meeting: PQTS Breakout Room - Kickoff Call - February 04, 2026

post_quantum_context.highlight: Four Ethereum components rely on elliptic curves: execution, consensus, DAS, state
NIST standardization took 2016-2022; implementation still ongoing since 2017
NIST winners: ML-DSA, Falcon (lattice-based), Sphincs+ (hash-based) for signatures
Quantum computing acceleration in 2024 from Google, Microsoft requires action now

precompile_proposals.highlight: EIP-8051: ML-DSA precompile, NIST-compliant and Keccak variant, 8M gas target
EIP-8052: Falcon precompile, 1.6M gas using Keccak, smaller signatures than ML-DSA
ML-DSA standardized (FIPS 204); Falcon standardization still in progress
ML-DSA easier to implement, works on hardware wallets; Falcon RAM-intensive

account_abstraction_integration.highlight: Demo: ML-DSA transactions working today via 4337 at ~$2 cost on L1
4337 deployment vulnerable to front-running; native AA needed for full security
EIP-8141: Frame transactions enable native AA with flexible signature validation
Frame transactions: verification frame (no gas), execution frame (gas charged)

proof_of_seed_emergency_mitigation.highlight: Proof of seed: graceful emergency fallback requiring no prior user action
ZK proof lifts ECDSA to quantum-resistant by proving knowledge of seed
BIP-32/BIP-39: Multiple lifting opportunities from child key to master seed
MPC-in-the-Head proofs fit secure element memory constraints (2KB footprint)

cryptographic_agility.highlight: Crypto agility: add/remove algorithms without major protocol changes
Current transactions not crypto-agile: V,R,S values encode specific ECDSA algorithm
Agile design: separate signature from transaction payload, easily swap algorithms
Support multiple PQ schemes simultaneously; add/remove independently over time

organizational.highlight: Breakout room scope: execution layer only (transactions); other layers separate efforts
Next call in 2 weeks: multi-signatures, aggregatable signatures, additional topics

action_items.action: Integrate cryptographic agility principles with EIP-8141 frame transaction design
Collaborate on BIP-39 proof of seed implementation between ZKnox and NeverLocal teams

decisions.decision: Support multiple PQ signature schemes simultaneously; users choose based on requirements
Account abstraction is the foundational layer for all PQ transaction work

targets.target: EthCC - Full proof of seed demonstrator with concrete implementation
February 18, 2026 - Next PQTS breakout call covering multi-sig and aggregation
